content.question: Which of the age structure diagrams would best correspond to a rapidly growing country?

choices.label: The figure presents an age structure diagram. The left side of the graph is labeled males. The right side of the graph is labeled females. An arrow on the vertical axis indicates that age increases vertically. Both sides of the graph are symmetrical and form a downward facing parabola.

The figure presents an age structure diagram. The left side of the graph is labeled males. The right side of the graph is labeled females. An arrow on the vertical axis indicates that age increases vertically. Both sides of the graph are symmetrical and form a column at the bottom of the graph, continuing into a pyramid at the top of the graph.

The figure presents an age structure diagram. The left side of the graph is labeled males. The right side of the graph is labeled females. An arrow on the vertical axis indicates that age increases vertically. Both sides of the graph are symmetrical and form the shape of a pyramid.

The figure presents an age structure diagram. The left side of the graph is labeled males. The right side of the graph is labeled females. An arrow on the vertical axis indicates that age increases vertically. Both sides of the graph are symmetrical and form the shape of a downward facing parabola at the top of the graph but at the bottom of the graph, instead of opening up like a parabola, the shape narrows and curves inward.

content.answer: The figure presents an age structure diagram. The left side of the graph is labeled males. The right side of the graph is labeled females. An arrow on the vertical axis indicates that age increases vertically. Both sides of the graph are symmetrical and form the shape of a pyramid.

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain relationships between different characteristics of environmental concepts, processes, or models represented visually. a. In theoretical contexts. b. In applied contexts.
